channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: M25 protests: Activists return to Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent
item.description: Activists from Insulate Britain cause disruption in Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent.

item.title: Covid: Plan B would be triggered by NHS pressure, Sajid Javid says
item.description: It comes as government scientists warn of a jump in Covid hospital admissions if rules are not tightened.

item.title: Woman arrested after girl, 5, found dead in Ealing
item.description: Met Police homicide detectives said the woman and the victim are known to each other.

item.title: Boy's flood death site to be investigated
item.description: Spelthorne councillors demand immediate action to investigate a former landfill site in Chertsey.

item.title: Knives in court: Rise in blades found at London family courts
item.description: In total 5,000 bladed articles - including small knives and syringes - were confiscated in 2019-20.

item.title: Battle of Britain: Restored Spitfire unveiled in Stoke-on-Trent
item.description: It is hoped the Spitfire, which will be on public display, will inspire future engineers.

item.title: Men charged with murder after bodies found in Bristol house
item.description: Ionut-Valentin Boboc and Jacob Bebe Chers are due to appear before Bristol Magistrates later.

item.title: Nicholas Burton: Family of killer's victim stunned by release claim
item.description: The brother of Nicholas Burton's victim says a claim he will be released in 2022 is "outrageous".

item.title: Matfen Hall: Couples 'distraught' as weddings cancelled amid price hike
item.description: Couples due to wed at a country hotel are told they must spend £20,000 or lose their bookings.

item.title: The Birmingham LGBT café providing a safe space
item.description: The not-for-profit café has a "pay-as-you-feel" policy so people struggling financially can eat.

item.title: Brendon Prince: Paddleboarder completes round-trip of mainland Britain
item.description: Sea safety campaigner Brendon Prince arrives back in Devon following the 141 day challenge.

item.title: The litter-laden alleyways transformed by residents
item.description: Residents decided to turn fly-tipping-laden alleyways into vibrant community spaces.

item.title: Coronavirus: Matlock Bath Illuminations return after cancellation
item.description: The colourful event in Derbyshire sees hand-crafted boats parade on the River Derwent.

item.title: Suffolk school visited by Wattisham Airfield Apache helicopter
item.description: Pupils at Kersey Primary School are given a show and tell they will never forget.

item.title: Felixstowe arrival of largest container ship Ever Ace caught on drone
item.description: The aerial pictures show the Ever Ace coming in to dock at Felixstowe in Suffolk.

item.title: M25 climate protest: Aerials show long traffic queues as junctions blocked
item.description: Climate change protesters are demanding government action on home insulation.

item.title: Buckland St Mary air crash: Family pays tribute to killed artist
item.description: Margaret Costa, who died in an air crash, was her family's "foundation stone", her relatives say.

item.title: Thin Blue Paw Awards: Suicide-prevention dog wins
item.description: German shepherd Calli and PC Megan West win the lifesaver category at the Thin Blue Paw Awards.

item.title: Grimsby hospital: High demand blamed for A&E queue
item.description: There was a lack of space for walk-ins at Grimsby's hospital due to social distancing, a trust says.

item.title: Lingard will bounce back from error, says Solskjaer
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says Jesse Lingard will learn from his mistake after Manchester United suffer shock Champions League defeat to Young Boys.

item.title: Chelsea 1-0 Zenit: Romelu Lukaku gives Blues win in Champions League
item.description: Romelu Lukaku's header gives Chelsea a winning start to the defence of their Champions League title with victory over Zenit.

item.title: CJ Ujah: British Olympic 4x100m relay silver medallist's 'B' sample positive
item.description: British Olympic silver medallist CJ Ujah's 'B' sample tests positive, following his initial positive test at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Hampshire beat Notts to go top of County Championship
item.description: Hampshire will lead the title race into the final round of Championship games after a 122-run win over Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Young Boys 2-1 Manchester United: Cristiano Ronaldo scores but Red Devils suffer shock defeat
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores on his Champions League return for Manchester United but it is not enough as Young Boys strike in stoppage-time to cap a remarkable comeback win.
